list_definition.definition: a (usually small) house of one storey/story

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They live in a small bungalow.

list_ex_of_english: Recently, however, rather impressive bungalows, made from concrete and finished with teakwood and marble floors, have sprung up amid the workers' houses and dyeing units.
In consequence of this, small antelopes may often be seen within the bungalow enclosures.
We retain two walls of the old bungalow in which new windows modify the existing openings.
He built a bungalow for himself in course of time.
The bungalows have bedrooms opening out onto a central sitting/ dining/counter kitchen unit.
And then there were four bungalows built, on a little ridge, and we bought one of those.
She lived alone in a comfortable bungalow on the outskirts of a thriving market town.
Post-war local authority housing arranged around cul-de-sacs and individual private bungalows set back within large plots do virtually nothing to define a streetscape.
